page.title: 02MILTON ABBAS and WHITECHURCH
page.content: WINTERBORNE WHITECHURCH -MILTON ABBAS. The area covered by the survey includes only two villages. Milton Abbas, the model village of the eight- eenth century, is the younger. The then owner of Milton Abbey, Joseph Damer Earl of Dorchester, decided that the village which surrounded the Abbey was too near so he built the present village and cleared the old leaving but one cottage still in use by the Public School housed in the Earl's old home. The Benedictine Abbey was founded in the 10th Century. Winterborne Whitechurch is clearly identified in Domesday Book as land owned by Milton Abbey. La Lee Farm, situated above the School, takes its name from Winterburn La Lee noted in early 13th century titles. Winterborne Whitechurch has a population of 650.
